annotation.message: An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.
An operand identifier [reference] is hiding another identifier of the same name.

a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SHepatitisB3DoseLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.Hepatitis B.3-dose schedule) * Schedule Table: 3-dose schedule (birth dose + 2 primary series doses), on-time start */ library IMMZD18SHepatitisB3DoseLogic

def.name: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Type of dose"= "Primary series") = 1

a:s.a:s: "One hepatitis B primary series dose was administered"

expression.name: One hepatitis B primary series dose was administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of hepatitis B dose 1

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: Child's birth

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date of birth"

a:s.a:s: "First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered"

operand.name: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date of birth" + Member States defined lower limit

a:s.a:s: // Syntax is strange because using a parameter else null

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: The following option is considered appropriate: a 3-dose schedule with the first dose (monovalent) being given at birth and the second and third (monovalent or as part of a combined vaccine) given at the same time as the first and third doses of DTP-containing vaccine. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:s.a:s: 'The following option is considered appropriate: a 3-dose schedule with the first dose (monovalent) being given at birth and the second and third (monovalent or as part of a combined vaccine) given at the same time as the first and third doses of DTP-containing vaccine. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.'

operand.value: The following option is considered appropriate: a 3-dose schedule with the first dose (monovalent) being given at birth and the second and third (monovalent or as part of a combined vaccine) given at the same time as the first and third doses of DTP-containing vaccine. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 1 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

def.name: Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was over 2000 g and was not a premature infant

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was over 2000 g and was not a premature infant

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Type of dose"= "Primary series") = 2

a:s.a:s: "Two hepatitis B primary series doses were administered"

expression.name: Two hepatitis B primary series doses were administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of hepatitis B dose 2

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines" and "Type of dose"= "Primary series") = 1

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered"
"Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was over 2000 g and was not a premature infant"

operand.name: First hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered
Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was over 2000 g and was not a premature infant

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines") + 4 weeks

operand.name: Date of Latest Hepatitis B Dose

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: The following option is considered appropriate: a 3-dose schedule with the first dose (monovalent) being given at birth and the second and third (monovalent or as part of a combined vaccine) given at the same time as the first and third doses of DTP-containing vaccine. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:s.a:s: 'The following option is considered appropriate: a 3-dose schedule with the first dose (monovalent) being given at birth and the second and third (monovalent or as part of a combined vaccine) given at the same time as the first and third doses of DTP-containing vaccine. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.'

operand.value: The following option is considered appropriate: a 3-dose schedule with the first dose (monovalent) being given at birth and the second and third (monovalent or as part of a combined vaccine) given at the same time as the first and third doses of DTP-containing vaccine. The interval between doses should be at least 4 weeks.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 2 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date.

a:t.name: dynamicValue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

def.name: Third hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was less than 2000 g and was a premature infant

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: Third hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was less than 2000 g and was a premature infant

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Completed the primary vaccination series" = TRUE (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "Three hepatitis B primary series doses were administered"

expression.name: Three hepatitis B primary series doses were administered

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 3

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Provision of hepatitis B dose 3 for low-birth-weight and premature infants

a:t.name: trigger
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines") = 2 and ("Birth weight in grams" < 2000) or ("Preterm birth" = TRUE)

a:t.name: triggerDate
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was over 2000 g and was not a premature infant"
"Third hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was less than 2000 g and was a premature infant"
"Client's weight at birth was below 2000 g"
"Client was a premature infant at birth"

operand.name: Second hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was over 2000 g and was not a premature infant
Third hepatitis B dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed for client whose weight at birth was less than 2000 g and was a premature infant
Client's weight at birth was below 2000 g
Client was a premature infant at birth

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 3 Due Date

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Hepatitis B-containing vaccines") + 4 weeks

operand.name: Date of Latest Hepatitis B Dose

a:t.name: output
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 3 Create

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: A birth dose of hepatitis B-containing vaccine can be given to low-birth-weight (< 2000 g) and premature infants. For these infants, the birth dose should not count as part of the primary 3-dose series; the 3 doses of the standard primary series should be given according to the national vaccination schedule.

a:s.a:s: 'A birth dose of hepatitis B-containing vaccine can be given to low-birth-weight (< 2000 g) and premature infants. For these infants, the birth dose should not count as part of the primary 3-dose series; the 3 doses of the standard primary series should be given according to the national vaccination schedule.'

operand.value: A birth dose of hepatitis B-containing vaccine can be given to low-birth-weight (< 2000 g) and premature infants. For these infants, the birth dose should not count as part of the primary 3-dose series; the 3 doses of the standard primary series should be given according to the national vaccination schedule.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 3 Overdue

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date.

a:t.name: dynamicValue
a:t.value: Hepatitis B dose 3 Expiration

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.

a:t.name: test
a:t.value: Test expected results based on example patients
